Description: Stone jar, probably limestone; short concave neck with flaring rim with broad, flat upper face and lip on interior; elaborate scale pattern engraved into top; ovoid body with footed base; three rhomboidal handles on shoulder, each with carved detail on side, engraved line at edge and hole drilled horizontally through near top; part of rim and one of handles missing.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: This vessel copies Aegean ceramic and metal three-handled jars but its precise place of manufacture is unclear. See Bevan 2007 passim for an overview and typological guide to stone vessels of this kind. Bibliography: Bevan A. 2007, Stone vessels and values in the Bronze Age Mediterranean (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P35, Fig 63)
SCE IV/1D / The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV. Part 1D. The Late Cypriot Bronze Age. Other arts and crafts (p. 542, Jar no. 6)
